channel.title: Mes on Dr. Jonathan Kent
channel.description: Recent content in Mes on Dr. Jonathan Kent

item.title: Latest Paper
item.description: Now out in City, Culture & Society, my paper on the relationship between urban land use and sympathy for far-right political parties.

item.title: Dissertation
item.description: In November 2023, I successfully defended my dissertation on the impact of urban design on the attitudes and behaviors of city dwellers.

item.title: Publications
item.description: For more on my academic output, take a look at my Google Scholar page. My work uses machine learning and Bayesian statistics to tackle a wide range of topics including urban design, attitudes toward diversity, human mobility, mosquito encounters, and sports analytics.

item.title: FUTSTAT.CAT
item.description: My first public foray into sports analytics forecasts men’s and women’s Catalan football leagues from La Liga to the fifth tier. Visca Bar√ßa! Dale UESA!

item.title: Road Running
item.description: Like so many runners—especially those of us from New England—I am determined to eventually run a Boston Marathon qualifying time. My marathon personal best stands at 3:13 (8 minutes shy of a BQ) and, as you can see from the plot here, the journey has been long.

item.title: Baseball Analytics
item.description: During the early months of the pandemic, I launched KBOfancystats.com which provides advanced analytics and predictions for Korean baseball fans.

item.title: Marathon Training Data Project
item.description: There are number of excellent apps and websites that take running data from GPS watches and generate race time predictions, visualizations, and even training recommendations. Honestly, checking these sites can become a bit of an obsession. Wise coaches insist that consistency is what matters, but marathoners are perfectionists, addicted to improvement.
